title: What you need to know about Kashmir, the scenic Himalayan region at the heart of tensions between India and Pakistan
text:
In early August, India scrapped Kashmir's special status, splitting the state into the two directly administered territories.

The move thrust the Himalayan region back to the front of tensions between India and Pakistan, which have simmered for more than 70 years.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

The Muslim-majority Himalayan region of Kashmir has been at the heart of more than 70 years of animosity since the partition of the British colony of India into the separate countries of Muslim Pakistan and majority Hindu India.
